intro: Alfaroa costaricensis, commonly known as the Costa Rican alfaroa, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or white. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
